title: Model Library | Anton Ebsen
description: A technical catalog of the economic frameworks and models I master â€“ from SVAR to DSGE.

hero.title: Model Library
hero.text: Understanding the theory behind the buttons is what separates a good economist from a data entry clerk. Here is a review of the models I work with.

models.title: SVAR (Structural Vector Autoregression)
models.desc: Used to identify structural shocks in macroeconomic time series.
models.tech: Used in bachelor's project to isolate US monetary policy shocks via 'Sign Restrictions'.
models.formula: B_0 y_t = c + B_1 y_{t-1} + ... + B_p y_{t-p} + \epsilon_t

models.title: DSGE (Dynamic Stochastic General Equilibrium)
models.desc: Micro-founded macro models used to simulate economic policies.
models.tech: Experience with Dynare and calibration of neoclassical growth models.

models.title: Taylor Rules
models.desc: A monetary reaction function determining the optimal interest rate based on inflation and output gap.
models.tech: Interactive simulator built with React & Chart.js.

models.title: CGE (Computable General Equilibrium)
models.desc: Static and dynamic modeling of entire economies, often used for trade and tax policy.
models.tech: Programming in GAMS to solve complex market equilibria.
